thread.title: Fall into the Arts brightens downtown
thread.title_full: Fall into the Arts brightens downtown

title: Fall into the Arts brightens downtown
text:
Fall into the Arts brightens downtown Battle Creek Enquirer 9:42 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 Sylas Oakley and Leslie Price enjoying the Battle Creek Model Railroad Club's contribution to Fall into The Arts. The two are new to the Battle Creek area. (Photo: Sarah Huling/For the Enquirer) 
Fall into the Arts had a perfect autumn evening on Friday. Patrons of the arts donned hats and mittens to stroll around downtown Battle Creek as the sun set. 
Artists set up in businesses, showing off everything from photography to fibers to tire sculptures. Nick Jakubiak's Tired Pandas, which were a favorite at ArtPrize in 2013, were parked outside of Pastrami Joe's. Fire artists spun and spat flames in front of a crowd at Wave Square. The Battle Creek Model Railroad Club opened the doors to their working train display in the basement of the Worgess Building. 
This was the first year Battle Creek Chamber of Commerce hosted the event. BCreative sponsored a people's choice award. Read or Share this story: http://bcene.ws/1LyPs3B TOP VIDEOS
